title.value: Pharmaceutical Quality/Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls Implementation Guides

publisher.value: U.S. Federal Drug Administration - Center for Drug Evaluation and Research

description.value: IG for standardizing submissions relating to the Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC) of regulated products
Constraints on FHIR resources to be adhered to as part of the PQ-CMC implementation guide
Extensions defined as part of the PQ-CMC implementation guide
ValueSets (and Code Systems) defined for use within the PQ-CMC implementation guide
Example(s) showing the use of the PQ-CMC profiles
The various kinds of files/documents submitted to the FDA for approval and or in support of a drug in the United States [Source: SME Defined].

A unique identifier assigned by the FDA to each application for approval and or in support of a drug in the United States. Often known as the application number. This includes all the types captured in the Application type data element [Source: SME Defined]

The current FDA regulatory status of the specification. [Source: SME Defined] Examples: Approved, Not Approved, etc. Note: There are instances when FDA does approve the Specifications in a supplement or an amendment where other information in the dossier has not changed. Note: This is different from Application Status
A coded value specifying the source of the method. [Source: SME Defined] Example: Compendial

The ratio of the retention time of a component relative to that of another used as a reference obtained under identical conditions as an alias for the name of the unidentified impurities. [Source: Adapted from USP] Example: 1:23 a ratio Note: This is the title or name of the impurity and not the value.
A textual field to provide any additional information about the acceptance criteria. [Source: SME Defined] Example: value changed from 4% to 5% on 01/01/2010
The display sequence of the test.
A code to designate a group of alternate tests vs a singular test.

A coded value specifying when a particular analytical procedure or measurement is being performed on a substance or a product. [Source: SME Defined] Examples: Release, Stability. Note: The concept of In-Process is subsumed by the Release code.

The text of the acceptance criteria as provided in the specification. [Source: SME Defined] Examples: White to off-white cake; 22.5 - 27.5 mg/ml Note: This is the text as it appears in the Specification.

A code that describes how to relate the given value to an acceptance value. [Source: SME Defined] Note: When result value is numeric there is a controlled vocabulary; when result value is textual the vocabulary is Pass/Fail.
The various kinds of files/documents submitted to the FDA for approval and or in support of a drug in the United States [Source: SME Defined].

The form in which active and/or inert ingredient(s) are physically presented. [Source: NCI EVS - C42636] Examples: tablet, capsule, solution, cream, etc. that contains a drug substance generally, but not necessarily, in association with excipients. [Source: ICH Q1A(R2)] Note: If there is a new dosage form that does not exist in the controlled terminology, then propose register this new dosage form during sponsor meetings with FDA. SME comment -- this is the marketed dosage form
Code indicating the current FDA regulatory status of the specification.
Classification of a sections of a PQ/CMC composition/document generally based on eCTD Module 3 section numbering for product and substance. A composition can have many section codes.
A classification of specification related to the kind of the entity it is referencing.
Codes specifying the source of the method.
List of test categories allowable values for the Test Category data element

A code that describes how to relate the given value to an acceptance value. [Source: SME Defined] Note: When result value is numeric there is a controlled vocabulary; when result value is textual the vocabulary is Pass/Fail.
List of codes specifying the time point during the manufacturing process of a substance or product when a particular analytical procedure or measurement is being performed
FHIR XML illustrating a Drug Product Quality Specification
FHIR XML illustrating a Drug Substance Quality Specification
